summary: An FBI Special Agent from the Miami Division/West Palm Beach Office emails a conference coordinator to inquire about a financial/investment conference in New Orleans between 1998-2000. The agent is seeking to determine if Jeffrey Epstein attended the conference and to identify the hotels used, as part of an investigation.

persons.name: J. Fri
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent from the Miami Division/West Palm Beach Office who is conducting the inquiry about the New Orleans investment conference and Jeffrey Epstein's potential attendance.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as one of the individuals the FBI is trying to determine if he attended the New Orleans Investment Conference between 1998-2000.

connections.description: FBI Special Agent J. Fri is investigating whether Jeffrey Epstein attended a specific investment conference in New Orleans.

events.title: New Orleans Investment Conference Inquiry
events.description: The FBI is investigating a financial/investment conference that took place in New Orleans between approximately 1998-2000, seeking to determine if Jeffrey Epstein attended and which hotels were used.

keyFacts: The FBI is actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's activities and travel, specifically regarding a financial conference in New Orleans between 1998-2000.
The inquiry seeks to identify the specific conference and hotels used, indicating a focus on establishing Epstein's whereabouts and associations during that period.
The document is dated April 14, 2011, showing federal investigative activity into Epstein years after his 2008 plea deal.
The FBI agent provides official contact information and offers for switchboard operators to verify their identity, indicating a formal investigative request.
